docstr:
`BTEST` — Bit test function

### Description
`BTEST(I,POS)` returns logical `.TRUE.` if the bit at `POS`
in `I` is set.  The counting of the bits starts at 0.



### Syntax
`RESULT = BTEST(I, POS)`


### Arguments

     
. 

 | `POS`  | The type shall be `INTEGER`.






### Return value
The return value is of type `LOGICAL`


### Example

     ```


program test_btest

    integer :: i = 32768 + 1024 + 64

    integer :: pos

    logical :: bool

    do pos=0,16

        bool = btest(i, pos)

        print *, pos, bool

    end do

end program test_btest

```

     

### Standard
Fortran 95 and later



### Class
Elemental function
